104.heading: Taliaferro, Al, 1906-1969.
104.title: "The Monarch of Medioka, pt. 4"
104.author: plot & pencils, Floyd Gottfredson ; written by Ted Osborne and Merrill de Maris ; inked by Al Taliaferro and Ted Thwaites
104.appears_in: 16 p. in Walt Disney's Comics & Stories, no. 596 (Apr. 1995); originally syndicated Aug. 9, 1937 to Feb. 5, 1938.
notes: SUMMARY: Mickey cuts taxes and starts and economic revival, but now he has to marry Phylline; meanwhile Minnie and Duke Varlott are each trying to capture the real king, who's living it up as a "mystery playboy" on the Continent. I. [Each creator] II. Mickey Mouse. k. Tax cuts. k. Economic revivals. k. Revivals. k. Marriage. k. Minnie Mouse. k. Varlott, Duke. k. Kings. k. Living it up. k. Mystery playboys. k. Playboys. k. The Continent. Call no.: PN6728.1.D4W3no.596

122.title: "A Fundamentalist is a Fundamentalist is a Fundamentalist"
122.author: Oliphant

123.heading: Taliban.
123.title: "Huey Helps the FBI Wage War on Terrorism!"
123.author: Aaron McGruder.
notes: Summary: U.S. government gave Taliban $43 million in May 2001.

124.heading: Taliban.
124.title: "The Men Responsible for this Criminal Act Must Be Brought to Justice"
124.author: by Tom Tomorrow.
notes: Summary: Retaliation in the form of a crusade will just give Bin Laden and the Taliban the holy war they want, and meanwhile Jerry Falwell blames the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes on liberal secular humanists, feminists, gays, and the ACLU.

132.title: Tales to Astonish
notes:
Tales to Astonish. -- New York : Vista Publications, 1959-1968. -- col. ill. ; 26 cm. -- Published no. 1 (Jan. 1959) - no. 101 (Mar. 1968). -- Continued by: Incredible Hulk. -- LIBRARY HAS: no. 1, 4, 10, 13-14, 16-23, 25, 29-30, 33-36, 41-42, 44-101. -- Call no.: PN6728.2.M3T3

Began as a mildly scary fantasy comic and developed into a superhero title featuring

  • Ant Man (issues 27, 35-48)
  • Giant Man (issues 49-69)
  • The Hulk (issues 59-101)
  • Sub-Mariner (issues 70-101)
  • Tales of the Wasp (issues 52-56, 58)
